title: 103_hr5172
content: The Act is titled the "Safe Meat and Poultry Inspection Panel Act" and establishes the Safe Meat and Poultry Inspection Panel. The Federal Meat Inspection Act is amended to establish the Safe Meat and Poultry Inspection Panel in the Department of Agriculture. The panel will review and make recommendations on inspection procedures, worker relations, and proposed changes in plants inspected under the Act. The Safe Meat and Poultry Inspection Panel, established under the Federal Meat Inspection Act, consists of 7 members primarily from the food, meat, and poultry science profession. They review inspection procedures, worker relations, and proposed regulatory changes within specified time limits. The panel also addresses any matters referred by the Secretary regarding the quality and effectiveness of the meat inspection system. The Safe Meat and Poultry Inspection Panel consists of 7 members with backgrounds in public health and scientific expertise in food, meat, and poultry sciences or veterinary science. The Secretary solicits nominees from the National Institutes of Health and the American Meat Science Association for panel membership, filling vacancies with 2 nominees from each organization. Nominees may be required to submit additional information for selection. The Secretary may request additional nominees if the initial list is unsatisfactory. Panel members receive compensation not exceeding GS-18 rates. Regulations on conflicts of interest will be promulgated. Panel reports to the Secretary will be published in the Federal Register. Within 90 days of a panel report being published in the Federal Register, the Secretary must provide a response. The Secretary will allocate necessary funds from available resources to implement this section. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. The Poultry Products Inspection Act is amended to establish the 'Safe Meat and Poultry Inspection Panel' to review and make recommendations on inspection procedures, worker relations, and changes in poultry inspection regulations. The 'Safe Meat and Poultry Inspection Panel' reviews poultry inspection regulations and other matters referred by the Secretary for a safe and cost-effective inspection system under the Poultry Products Inspection Act.
